name: indulgence socks
notes:
it all started with looking through my stash, picking out the earthy coloured balls of yarn and thinking what to do with only 1 ball of each colours. it was a cold winter morning and my feet just couldnâ€™t warm up. i need some warm cosy socks! and there is nothing better than handmade socks. i paired the natural wool with silk mohair to add strength and extra softness. whilst knitting them i gave each sock a different name. and because they just look so scrumptious i named the collection "indulgence socks".

yarn: 
palette 50g (100% peruvian highland wool) held together with drops silk mohair 25g | both fingering weight | palette 231yds drops 210yds = 1 strand of each yarn held together.

needles: 
3mm (us 2.5)
for sample used addi 9inch circular needles. tapestry needles to weave the ends in. stitch markers or scrap yarn.

gauge:
30 sts / 30 rounds = 10 x 10 cm / 4 x 4 inches, knitted in the round in stockinette stitch and blocked

sizes:
1 (2) 3 (4) finished sock circumference: 18 / 20.5 / 23 / 25.5cm ( 7 / 8 / 9 / 10inch ), to be worn with slight ease. skeins of each yarn = 1 (1) 2 for 1 pair of socks. if you are planning to make the cuffs longer or foot size larger than 6uk (us8) i suggest you get 2 skeins of each yarn.

please note: the pattern features a "yarn over short row heel" not a german short row heel.
